message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper deals with improving the performance of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) in handling boundaries of images. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a new method for learning boundary handling, which involves providing the network with a separate set of explicit boundary filters at training-time. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deal with various aspects of learning and optimization in neural networks. Finally, the paper evaluates its method on several applications, including colorization, de-Bayering, optical flow, and disparity estimation, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the category of cs.MM (Multimedia).
